segment.source: Open a Recording
segment.target: Open a Recording

segment.source: Open a Recording
segment.target: Open a Recording

segment.source: Open a Recording
segment.target: Open a Recording

segment.source: You can open any recording that Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) or the Assessment Platform created in Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).
segment.target: You can open any recording that Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) or the Assessment Platform created in Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).

segment.source: To open a recording in WPA
segment.target: To open a recording in WPA

segment.source: On the File menu, click Open.
segment.target: On the File menu, click Open.

segment.source: Browse to the location of the event trace log (ETL) file for the recording.
segment.target: Browse to the location of the event trace log (ETL) file for the recording.

segment.source: By default, WPR saves ETL files to the user's Documents folder in a folder that it creates called WPR Files.
segment.target: By default, WPR saves ETL files to the user's Documents folder in a folder that it creates called WPR Files.

segment.source: Click the desired file, and then click Open.
segment.target: Click the desired file, and then click Open.

segment.source: To open a recording from assessment results
segment.target: To open a recording from assessment results

segment.source: On the View Results page, click the WPA in-depth analysis link in the Issues pane.
segment.target: On the View Results page, click the WPA in-depth analysis link in the Issues pane.

segment.source: You may need to expand the issue to see this link.
segment.target: You may need to expand the issue to see this link.

segment.source: Not all issues have a link to WPA.
segment.target: Not all issues have a link to WPA.

segment.source: To view graphs on the Analysis tab
segment.target: To view graphs on the Analysis tab

segment.source: In the Graph Explorer window, expand the desired node by clicking the triangle.
segment.target: In the Graph Explorer window, expand the desired node by clicking the triangle.

segment.source: Drag a graph or graphs from the Graph Explorer window to the Analysis tab.
segment.target: Drag a graph or graphs from the Graph Explorer window to the Analysis tab.

segment.source: You will see a tree view of the lines on the graph to the left of the graph itself.
segment.target: You will see a tree view of the lines on the graph to the left of the graph itself.

segment.source: This is called the Legend control.
segment.target: This is called the Legend control.

segment.source: On the right side of the graph title bar, there are layout icons to select the layout for the graph.
segment.target: On the right side of the graph title bar, there are layout icons to select the layout for the graph.

segment.source: By default, the center icon is selected and only the graph and its Legend control are displayed.
segment.target: By default, the center icon is selected and only the graph and its Legend control are displayed.

segment.source: If you select the layout icon on the left, the data table associated with the graph appears below the Legend control and graph.
segment.target: If you select the layout icon on the left, the data table associated with the graph appears below the Legend control and graph.

segment.source: This table contains the same data as the graph.
segment.target: This table contains the same data as the graph.

segment.source: If you select the layout icon on the right, only the data table is displayed.
segment.target: If you select the layout icon on the right, only the data table is displayed.
